title: Bug: Waiting customers don't enter stalls when they become available
description:
## Bug
When all stalls are full or being cleaned, customers wait and do the pee dance. But when stalls become available again, the waiting customers don't continue into the now-empty stalls.

## Expected Behavior
- Customers waiting should detect when a stall becomes empty
- First waiting customer should claim the stall and walk to it
- Continue normal flow: walk to stall ‚Üí enter ‚Üí use ‚Üí exit

## Root Cause Investigation
Check the customer phase state machine - likely missing logic to:
1. Re-evaluate available stalls when in 'waiting' state
2. Transition from waiting back to 'findStall' or 'toStall' phase

- Root cause was stale reservedBy references holding locks on stalls after customers were removed
- Fix runs every frame for customers in findStall, ensuring quick cleanup

title: Bug: Prevent Multiple Customers Entering Same Stall
description:
## Bug
Multiple customers may be able to enter the same stall simultaneously, causing overlap or weird behavior.

## Expected Behavior
- Only one customer can occupy a stall at a time
- Other customers should wait or find a different stall
- Stall should be marked 'occupied' immediately when customer starts entering

Check customer targeting logic - stall may not be marked occupied until customer fully enters, allowing race condition.
acceptance_criteria:

- [x] Stall marked occupied immediately when customer targets it - VERIFIED: reservation set in findStall phase before toStall transition

- [x] Customers correctly find alternate stalls when first choice taken - VERIFIED: findStall loops skip stalls with reservedBy set
notes:

### What was done
- Added `reservedBy` property to stall objects (initialized to null)
- Modified findStall phase to set `stall.reservedBy = p` immediately when customer targets a stall
- Updated findStall logic to skip stalls that are already reserved (both empty and dirty)
